    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TgStreamReader(BluetoothAdapter ba, TgStreamHandler tgStreamHandler)
      This method is used to connect NeuroSky's hardware with Android phone via Bluetooth, get the stream and parse the data.
      TgStreamReader(BluetoothDevice mBluetoothDevice, TgStreamHandler tgStreamHandler)
      This method is used to connect NeuroSky's hardware with given BluetoothDevice
      TgStreamReader(java.io.InputStream is, TgStreamHandler tgStreamHandler)
      This method is used to read back raw data from file and parse them.

      • TgStreamReader

        public TgStreamReader(java.io.InputStream is,
                      TgStreamHandler tgStreamHandler)
        This method is used to read back raw data from file and parse them. You have to get the InputStream first.
        Parameters:
        is - InputStream from the file
        tgStreamHandler - callback for TgStreamReader

      • getVersion

        Returns:
        the version of sdk

      • setParser

        public void setParser(TgStreamReader.ParserType parserType,
                      int sampleRate)
        Set parser for stream reader. If you are using Champion devices, you have to call this method, otherwise you do not need this method.
        Parameters:
        parserType - ParserType enum
        sampleRate - current support sample rate include 1024, 2048

      • startLog

        public void startLog()
        Enable the debug log.

      • stopLog

        public void stopLog()
        Disable the debug log. (Does not affect the error log)

      • setTgStreamHandler

        public void setTgStreamHandler(TgStreamHandler cb)
        Set the TgStreamHandler for TgStreamReader
        Parameters:
        cb - TgStreamHandler

      • setRecordStreamFilePath

        public void setRecordStreamFilePath(java.lang.String filePath)
        Set the file path for recording the stream data, the default path is /sdcard /neurosky/year-month-day-hour-minute-second-RawPackageRecording.txt
        Parameters:
        filePath - file path

      • startRecordRawData

        public void startRecordRawData()
        Set the record flag for reading thread. If the setRecordStreamFilePath() is not called yet, the default file path is used. If there are some exceptions occured, onRecordFail() in TgStreamHandler will be called. The int parameter flag indicates the fail reason: 1 means get the file path failed, even the default path; 2 means read thread is not working 3 means recording is started, you can not call it again. 4 means open the file failed.

      • stopRecordRawData

        public void stopRecordRawData()
        Stop record the stream data and flush the store file.

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Connect to the target. You should call connectAndStart() in common scene.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the reading thread. You should call connectAndStart() in common scene.

      • connectAndStart

        public void connectAndStart()
        The process of connect will take several seconds or more , if you don't want to handle the waiting time, use this method instead. This method will call start() automatically when connect successful. If you want to manage more detail between connect and start, call connect() and start() separately.

      • sendCommandtoDevice

        public void sendCommandtoDevice(byte[] command)
        Send command to device
        Parameters:
        command -

      • setGetDataTimeOutTime

        public void setGetDataTimeOutTime(int seconds)
        set the timeout time for read thread, the default time is 5s
        Parameters:
        seconds - time for timeout

      • setReadFileBlockSize

        public void setReadFileBlockSize(int size)
        Set the block size for reading file thread, the default size is 8.
        Parameters:
        size - bytes number

      • setReadFileDelay

        public void setReadFileDelay(int delayTime)
        If the working thread read file too fast, give a tiny delay after reading once, the default delay is 2ms
        Parameters:
        delayTime - time in ms

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the read thread. stopRecordRawData() will be called if startRecordRawData() is called successfully before.

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the connect thread, if it has not finished. Release the Bluetooth socket.

      • isBTConnected

        public boolean isBTConnected()
        Check the connected states
        Returns:
        true if connected, false for others

      • redirectConsoleLogToDocumentFolder

        public static void redirectConsoleLogToDocumentFolder()
        Redirect the console log to file under /sdcard/neruosky/Console_log/yyyyMMdd_HH_mm_ss.txt

      • stopConsoleLog

        public static void stopConsoleLog()
        Stop the console log process.

      • MWM15_setFilterType

        public void MWM15_setFilterType(MindDataType.FilterType type)
        Set the filter type with FilterType.FILTER_50HZ or FilterType.FILTER_60HZ. This function only support MindWave Mobile1.5. <\br> This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately. <\br> Please confirm the state is connected before calling this function. <\br> If you want to check the result, please call MWM15_getFilterType.
        Parameters:
        type -

      • MWM15_getFilterType

        public void MWM15_getFilterType()
        Get the working filter type information. <\br> Only support MindWave Mobile1.5. <\br> This is an asynchronous call, it will return immediately, and the filter type will return by TgStreamHandler.onDataReceived with data type MindDataType.CODE_FILTER_TYPE.<\br> Please confirm the state is connected before calling this function.
